Hi, I'm posting this in the religion section because I figured everyone checks it the most.
 
 
 I'm new on here, I mostly just sit back and read, but in an attempt to get to know everyone on here, I was wondering if you could let me know where you stand on these issues in a couple of words.
 
 Religion/abortion/political party/evolution/drugs/general interests
 
 Here's mine: No Religion, I'm not a child/pro-choice, but should be last resort/middle of the road, probably leaning more towards libertarian/best explanation/tried most of them when I was younger, not anymore/art
 
 Thanks for answering, nice to meet you. By the way, my name is Jason, 28 years old, originally from Alabama, lived in Australia and California, and I'm a graphic artist. Graduated from Cal in 2003.

post_info.post_title: Your Beliefs.  Getting to know You.

Hi, I'm posting this in the religion section because I figured everyone checks it the most.
 
 
 I'm new on here, I mostly just sit back and read, but in an attempt to get to know everyone on here, I was wondering if you could let me know where you stand on these issues in a couple of words.
 
 Religion/abortion/political party/evolution/drugs/general interests
 
 Here's mine: No Religion, I'm not a child/pro-choice, but should be last resort/middle of the road, probably leaning more towards libertarian/best explanation/tried most of them when I was younger, not anymore/art
 
 Thanks for answering, nice to meet you. By the way, my name is Jason, 28 years old, originally from Alabama, lived in Australia and California, and I'm a graphic artist. Graduated from Cal in 2003.
 Hi, Jason, and welcome to 4Forums! Hope you enjoy your stay.
 
 There IS a "getting-to-know-you" forum somewhere on the site for people to introduce themselves, btw, if you hunt around for it, but I don't know how many people actually avail themselves of it so maybe your way is best.
 
 My name is Michael, gay, atheist/rationalist, liberal , pro-choice, 58, UCLA grad, life-long SoCal resident, used to be primarily a writer (produced & published plays, aired TV shows, one published novel, many unproduced -- and one produced--screenplays), still write but now do graphic arts myself in the form of Flash, PowerPoint, Illustrator, etc. to survive. One son, 16. Live in L.A. Absolutely trust in science, incl. evolution, natural selection, biological sources of homosexuality, global warming, etc. and disdain supernatural sky-pixie-based explanations. Smoke grass on occasion, think it should be legalized. Interests: old movies, MST3K, British humor, Nabokov, Lewis Carroll, logic, vodka, games & puzzles, gay rights, lucid dreams. Heroes: Jefferson, Paine, Madison, Einstein, Stoppard, Anthony Burgess, Desmond Tutu, JK Rowling, Richard Dawkins.
 
 Again, welcome!
